prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We request continuum observations and have selected the standard frequency for Band-7 in order to reach the optimal sensitivity.
This is a detection experiment, we expect emission to come from scales of 0.1-0.5", thus requesting an angular resolution of 1.0".
We aim for a 3sigma detection limit for SFR rate of ~100 Msun/yr. Based on our predictions, this correspond to a 350GHz continuum flux of about 0.6 mJy. Thus we request a sensitivity of 0.2 mJy/beam.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: The correlation between the central super-massive black hole mass and the bulge is well-known and is related to the fuelling and termination of star formation and black hole accretion. Quasars are among the favoured targets in the high-z universe for studies related to the understanding of this correlation. About 1/3 of optically selected quasars show signs of intense star formation in particular through the presence of cold dust (e.g. Carilli et al., 2001). ALMA observations show that a fraction of bright submillimeter galaxies are in fact two or more galaxies within the same 15" beam (e.g. Hodge et al., 2013). Due to the absence of arcsec resolution observations, it is possible that FIR-bright quasars and radio galaxies also have unresolved companions. We here propose to do ALMA submillimeter observations of high-z quasars with the aim of finding quasar-gas-rich companion galaxy systems. In the possission of the submm observations we can investigate the submm properties (SFR, Tdust, etc.) of the quasars and the potential companions.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe

prp:PrincipalInvestigator.prp:organisation: Earth and Space Sciences, Chalmers University of Technology
